item.title: Osiris-Rex: Nasa confirms return of asteroid Bennu samples
item.description: A capsule carrying debris from asteroid Bennu lands safely in the Utah desert.

item.title: Asteroid Bennu: Why the return of samples is so important... in 83 seconds
item.description: It is hoped the material from Bennu could tell Nasa how life on Earth began.

item.title: Soldiers on standby to cover London police who hand in guns
item.description: Officers turned in their weapons after a marksman was charged with the murder of an unarmed man.

item.title: Kosovo and Serbia row over monastery gun battle
item.description: A Kosovan policeman and three ethnic Serb gunmen are dead after a siege of a monastery in Kosovo.

item.title: University staff strike disrupts freshers' week
item.description: The strikes are part of a long-running dispute by union members over pay and conditions.

item.title: Electric car rules could cost carmakers billions
item.description: New Brexit trade rules could push up the price of electric cars, manufacturers warn.

item.title: Niger coup: Macron says France to withdraw troops and ambassador
item.description: France's president says the ambassador will leave and all military co-operation will end in the coming months.

item.title: Olympic winner condemns black Irish girl's medal snub
item.description: US gymnastics legend Simone Biles says "there is no room for racism in sport" after footage of a black Irish girl not receiving a medal went viral.

item.title: Liberal Democrats face housebuilding target row at conference
item.description: Leader Ed Davey says he wants to focus on building social housing, rather than pledging 380,000 new homes a year.

item.title: Woman arrested after missing children found
item.description: Police find baby boy and three-year-old girl at address in Essex after five-day search.

item.title: Woman's body found in jaws of 13ft Florida alligator identified
item.description: A witness raised the alarm after seeing the large animal clutching human remains in a canal.

item.title: Wales 40-6 Australia: Warren Gatland's side hammer Wallabies to seal World Cup quarter-final spot
item.description: Wales become the first team to reach the 2023 World Cup quarter-finals as they celebrate a record win over Australia in Lyon.

item.title: The Papers: 'Army on standby' after armed officers down guns
item.description: The Met's request for help from the Army after officers put down their guns is widely reported in Monday's papers.

item.title: Canada-India row puts spotlight on Sikh activism in UK
item.description: Rumours swirl around the deaths of other Sikh activists, following Justin Trudeau's bombshell claim.

item.title: Ukraine war: Training to clear the world's most heavily mined country
item.description: How British military bomb disposal teams are helping Ukrainian engineers clear Russian minefields.

item.title: Farmers turn to tech as bees struggle to pollinate
item.description: With bee populations struggling, mechanical pollination may be increasingly needed as a back-up.

item.title: UCU university strikes: When are the next walkouts?
item.description: Five days of strike action will fall in Freshers' Week for many students.

item.title: Lobbyists take close-up look at Lib Dems
item.description: Businesses and campaigners say they have gravitated towards a party with a sense of optimism.

item.title: Trudeau facing cold reality after lonely week on world stage
item.description: As tensions with India rise, Canada is calling its friends - but they're not answering.

item.title: Russell Brand accuser sparks debate about staggered age of consent
item.description: Claims against the star have led to discussions about the power dynamic between adults and teens in relationships.

item.title: Wasdale mountain rescuer Penny Kirby celebrates 40 years' service
item.description: Penny Kirby and her dogs have found missing hikers and searched for terrorist victims.

item.title: HS2: 'Crazy' not to review project over soaring costs - Shapps
item.description: Grant Shapps cites Ukraine war costs and a spike in inflation as reasons to weigh up the rail project.

item.title: AI-generated naked child images shock Spanish town of Almendralejo
item.description: More than 20 Spanish girls in the small town of Almendralejo have so far come forward as victims.

item.title: Nagorno-Karabakh: Ethnic Armenians leave amid cleansing fear
item.description: Azerbaijan took full control of the territory in a flash operation, saying it would integrate residents.

item.title: Huge shelf cloud seen over Brazilian city
item.description: Timelapse video captured the weather phenomenon moving across the sky in Caxias do Sul.

item.title: Man gored to death by bull at Spanish festival
item.description: Friend also injured by same animal during the Pobla de Farnals festival in the Valencia region.

item.title: Ethiopia's Tigst Assefa smashes women's marathon world record in Berlin
item.description: Ethiopia's Tigst Assefa shatters the women's marathon world record as she wins in Berlin, while Eliud Kipchoge is the men's winner with record fifth victory.

item.title: Lost painting by Artemisia Gentileschi goes on display
item.description: The work by renowned painter Artemisia Gentileschi was left in storage for more than 100 years.

item.title: CBI: Scandal-hit organisation secures emergency funding
item.description: The business group has secured emergency funding from banks after a series of misconduct allegations.

item.title: Sheffield United 0-8 Newcastle United: Visitors thrash Blades to match their record Premier League win
item.description: Newcastle match their record Premier League win with a scintillating display as they embarrass winless Sheffield United at Bramall Lane.

item.title: Solheim Cup: Europe retain trophy with 14-14 tie with US in Spain
item.description: Spain's Carlota Ciganda sensationally holes the putt that sees Europe retain the Solheim Cup as they tie 14-14 with the United States in her homeland.

item.title: Arsenal 2-2 Tottenham: 'Ange Postecoglou has Spurs heading in right direction'
item.description: Everything about Tottenham's performance in the 2-2 draw at Arsenal suggests Ange Postecoglou knows the right direction for a club that had lost its way, writes Phil McNulty.

item.title: Match of the Day 2 analysis: How Newcastle exposed 'terrible' Sheffield United
item.description: Match of the Day 2 pundits Shay Given and Ian Wright analyse how Newcastle United exposed Sheffield United's defensive frailties in their 8-0 win at Bramall Lane.

item.title: Scotland 45-17 Tonga: Scots dominate to get job done amid Tonga tempest
item.description: Seven tries and missed opportunities, reckless hits and more TMO bunker controversy, Scotland's win over Tonga wasn't perfect but the team are still fighting for World Cup progress.

item.title: Solheim Cup 2023: Europe retain trophy after thrilling final day - best shots
item.description: Watch some of the best shots as Europe retain the Solheim Cup after tying 14-14 with the United States on a thrilling final day at Finca Cortesin in Spain.

item.title: How to get a job: Six expert tips for finding work
item.description: There are 10m people out of work in the UK, so if you're searching for a job you're not alone. Here are some tips on how to get started.

item.title: Five ways to save money on your packed lunch
item.description: Grabbing food on the go can be expensive so here are some top tips on making savings at lunchtime.

item.title: First time home buyers: How much can I borrow?
item.description: With rents rising, more people are crunching the numbers to see if they can afford to buy.

item.title: Food prices: How can I save money on my grocery shop?
item.description: The cost-of-living crisis continues to bite. Here are some things that can reduce the impact.

item.title: Fuel cost: How to save petrol and diesel
item.description: With weak competition adding to fuel prices, are drivers doing the right things to save money?

item.title: How to save money even when the budget is tight
item.description: The interest paid on savings is better than anything seen for years, so how can you save when bills are rising?

item.title: What is the UK inflation rate - and why is it so high?
item.description: The rate at which prices are rising has fallen but remains well above the 2% inflation target.

item.title: Rent increases: What you can do about a rise from your landlord
item.description: The BBC's Lora Jones tells you four things you can do, if your landlord asks for more money.

item.title: Mortgages: What happens if I am struggling to pay?
item.description: Many homeowners are worried about higher mortgage costs, but lenders must help those struggling.

item.title: What's happening to house prices - and could they crash?
item.description: How higher interest rates are changing the UK's housing market.

item.title: Interest rates: How the Bank of England's decision affects you and your money
item.description: The Bank of England has held interest rates at 5.25%, bringing a run of 14 consecutive rises to an end.

item.title: What to do if you're worried about your mortgage rate
item.description: Watch the BBC's Lora Jones tell you five things you can do about your mortgage, in a minute.

item.title: Mortgage calculator: how much will my mortgage go up?
item.description: Use our calculator to find out how much mortgage payments could go up for your household.

item.title: Debt: What do I do if I can't afford to pay?
item.description: What help and options are available to people struggling with debt repayments?

item.title: UK inflation rate calculator: How much are prices rising for you?
item.description: Use our calculator to find out how much the cost of living is going up in your household.

item.title: Train strikes: When is the next action happening?
item.description: Members of the RMT rail workers' union and Aslef train drivers' union are set to strike again.

item.title: Cost-of-living payments: Who is getting them and when?
item.description: Low-income households, pensioners and some disabled people will get extra help with energy bills.

item.title: Why inflation is falling but prices are still rising
item.description: We report this percentage every month but here are three things you may not know.

item.title: Rishi Sunak's five promises: What progress has he made?
item.description: In January the prime minister said five priorities should be used to hold his government to account.

item.title: What are my rights if my flight is cancelled or delayed?
item.description: Technical glitches have caused disruption at airports but passengers do have rights.

item.title: Could Rishi Sunak's green review threaten UK net zero?
item.description: The prime minister has rolled back some net zero policies, but says he's still committed to targets.

item.title: Electric cars quota remains despite petrol ban delay
item.description: Car makers will still have to ensure over a fifth of cars sold are electric from 2024.

item.title: Seven bins and Sunak's other net zero claims fact checked
item.description: We look at claims about seven bins, heat pumps and cutting emissions.

item.title: Rishi Sunak: Cars, boilers and net zero - key takeaways from PM's speech
item.description: The PM announces changes to his green approach, but says 2050 net zero targets will still be met.

item.title: Car makers split on decision to delay petrol ban
item.description: Some manufacturers have raised concerns that the move to 2035 could put drivers off switching to electric.

item.title: Then and now: How the PM shifted on green policies
item.description: Watch what the prime minister has said in the past, and what he's saying now.

item.title: What is net zero - and will the UK reach it?
item.description: The UK may weaken some key green commitments, despite its pledge to reach "net zero" by 2050.

item.title: Don't falter on green pledges, Boris Johnson urges Rishi Sunak
item.description: The PM's predecessor warns that firms cannot afford for ministers to lose "ambition" on climate goals.

item.title: Chris Mason: Sunak seeks to grab the agenda with green gamble
item.description: Sunak's mooted changes to net zero targets are far from tinkering at the edges, our political editor writes.

item.title: Rishi Sunak's green approach is pragmatic, says Suella Braverman
item.description: But the dilution of green policies has sparked anger among some Tories and opposition parties.
